definition: abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin

sentences.english: Your Party opposes a rise in the tax, but that did not seem to hurt it.
sentences.chinese: 新党反对加税，但是它好像不会去阻挠加税。

sentences.english: Suu Kyi has expressed dissatisfaction through her lawyer with the formation of the new breakaway party.
sentences.chinese: 昂山素季已经通过律师表达了对新党的成立的不满。

sentences.english: In the long term, no doubt, Mr Fini still aspires to the PdL leadership.
sentences.chinese: 从长远看来，菲尼先生无疑仍希望执掌自由人民新党。

sentences.english: The new party was born in farming areas of the West and South.
sentences.chinese: 新党诞生于西部和南部农区。

sentences.english: The Party's New Constitution is the great creed for the new century.
sentences.chinese: 新党章是新世纪新阶段与时俱进的伟大纲领。

sentences.english: The Party Congress also adopted the new Party Constitution.
sentences.chinese: 党的代表大会还通过了新党章。

sentences.english: The two groups have merged to form a new party.
sentences.chinese: 两大组织合并组成一个新党。

definition: DPP (Democratic Progressive Party, Taiwan)/abbr. for 民主進步黨|民主进步党
Lee Teng-hui (1923-2020), Taiwanese politician, president of ROC 1988-2000
Ma Ying-jeou (1950-), Taiwanese Kuomintang politician, Mayor of Taipei 1998-2006, president of Republic of China 2008-2016
William Lai Ching-te (1959-), Taiwanese DPP politician, vice president of the Republic of China from 2020
Chen Shui-Bian (1950-), Taiwanese DPP 民進黨|民进党 politician, president of the Republic of China 2000-2008
abbr. for 立法委員會|立法委员会[li4 fa3 wei3 yuan2 hui4]/abbr. for 立法委員|立法委员[li4 fa3 wei3 yuan2]
Tsai Ing-wen (1956-), Taiwanese DPP politician, president of the Republic of China from 2016
James Soong (1942-), Taiwanese politician expelled from Guomindang in 2000 when he founded People First Party 親民黨|亲民党
Legislative Yuan, the legislative branch of government under the constitution of Republic of China, then of Taiwan
